instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - stuck on batter logo with lighting,
threads.message:
, [ATTACH type="full" width="342px" alt="i.jpg"]59992[/ATTACH][ATTACH type="full" width="477px" alt=";.jpg"]59993[/ATTACH]



got this macbook it is tuck on battery logo with lighting under, draws 1.04 when battery logo comes up, then goes back to 0, and 20V

any ideas. maybe knows issue someone has already fixed,

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - stuck on batter logo with lighting,
threads.message: Test with both battery and charger connected.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - stuck on batter logo with lighting,
threads.message: i did and no difference at all,

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - stuck on batter logo with lighting,
threads.message:
Is the battery charging?
Did you test with known good battery?
Don't trust new chinese batteries.

Also try with other 87W original charger and 96W one too.
